clinicalHistory.guidelineTitle: Laboratory Evidence of Immunity or confirmation of Hepatitis B disease

contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Hepatitis B
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Hepatitis B vaccine.
Do not vaccinate if the patient has had an adverse reaction to a vaccine component.
Do not vaccinate if the patient has a hypersensitivity to yeast.
Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to neomycin.

contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction to polymyxin B
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to polymyxin B.

indication.description: Administer to persons seeking protection.
Administer to persons who have diabetes.
indication.guidance: For patients 60 years and under, vaccinate as soon as feasible after diagnosis, patients over the age of 60 years may be vaccinated

indication.description: Administer to persons who have chronic liver disease.

observationCode.text: Men who have sex with men

indication.description: Administer to men who have sex with men.

indication.description: Administer to persons not in a long-term, mutually monogamous relationship.

observationCode.text: Sex partner of Hepatitis B surface antigen-positive persons

indication.description: Administer to persons who are a sex partner of a Hepatitis B surface antigen-positive person.
Administer to persons who receive treatment for STD.
Administer to persons who use illicit injection drugs.
Administer to healthcare personnel.

Administer to persons with chronic renal disease.

observationCode.text: Travel to countries with high or intermediate prevalence of chronic HBV infection
